website_summaries.verdict: This versatile sharpener adapts to a blade's thickness to create a precise and custom finish.
pros: Features a three-stage sharpening system for professional results every time
Creates custom finishes with various controls that adapt to both the shape of knives as well as the blade's composition
Blade guides hold knife at the perfect angle
We love that it can rejuvenate 15-year-old knives and even improve their original sharpness
cons: Larger in size than other devices

customer_reviews.title: Complete crap, don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my mom over a month ago and I just got over to see it...boo... The closure setting won't stay and is too large even on the smallest setting. I have a Chef's Choice sharpener and this is not even close to the same. The worst part is the final wheel, it should be a strop like soft material but it is a hard grinding, non sharpening wheel like the first 2. DO NO BUY THIS PRODUCT, GO GET A CHEF'S CHOICE FOR QUALITY.
customer_reviews.author: BaronVonMunchin

customer_reviews.title: Great sharpener
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sharpener. First of all it is very big, I was not expecting it to be as large but I can see why. I have had smaller ones but this is heavy duty. There was actually metal dust from the blades being sharpened. Made our knives shaper than they'd ever been. I just ordered a second one for our cabin. Cant wait to cut thru some smoked meat with a real sharp knife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I've used this thing many times, and it does sharpen my knives more than manual devices I've used. But they never get as sharp as other reviewers say theirs have. I follow the directions, go very slowly, try not to change the angle, and so forth. Just not so sharp that I can't rub my thumb against the blade to test it. That should cut me, but it does not.
customer_reviews.author: David Bruck

customer_reviews.title: customer support
customer_reviews.text: the worst customer support i have ever dealt with product was so so. did not work for me
customer_reviews.author: Dave S.

customer_reviews.title: Want sharp knives
customer_reviews.text: I am a person with poor visual acuity (20/40 on my best day with good light but mostly 20/60) and low average spatial awareness and proficiency; therefore, any task using good vision and good hand-eye coordination is difficult. However, even with my limitations, I am able to sharpen all the knives in the kitchen so that they cut as well as the cooking videos on YouTube. Using the guides provided, draw your blade toward you without pushing down, and do this three times. Blades need regular sharpening: a dull blade is more dangerous than a sharp one.
customer_reviews.author: BERNARD F. CROWLEY

customer_reviews.title: Good sharpener for the price. Has some flaws but would buy again with post-purchase knowledge.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's good, but the quality control could be better. The "fine" sharpener for the left side of the blades does a very good job, the right one has an imperfection and leaves a small texture on the blade. I'm guessing this will vary from sharpener to sharpener and is due to the quality you get at this price point. The guards that you can adjust for blade width/angle are easily pushed out of the way so you have to be careful to not force the blade to a different angle. Overall a good product for the price but it does have some weaknesses.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H.

customer_reviews.title: Works best on kinchen knives, not that good for pocket knives
customer_reviews.text: 10-19-2018, revision: A... Works best on kinchen knives, not that good for pocket knives. If the knife cant be sharpened by other means this will sharpen it... On my pocket knife it appears to have ate a way too much metal. However, its now sharp. Whatever type of knife, it seems to approach the blade by making it serrated sort of, to make it sharp. The fine stone is too rough on the blade.
customer_reviews.author: AntennaMan

customer_reviews.title: Works Good Overall
customer_reviews.text: We had pretty dull knives. I think over time this will get them sharp. I did an initial pass on all three stages and definitely feel and see an improvement. I didn't want to go too crazy at first. You should expect a five minutes or more on a dull knife. You can't press too hard, as the motor slows down and stops with too much pressure. Just let the tool do the work and be patient. This is an upgrade from our manual knife sharpener which we tended to never use that much.
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use
customer_reviews.text: Was going to get another name brand more expensive sharpener, but the overwhelming number of good reviews for this one made me choose the presto instead. Was very easy to use, very easy to understand. Of course, the loud noise the knives make when going through the grinders, drove my dog and my children crazy, but I didn’t think it was that bad. Have been able to use knives that have set in the drawer on used for years because they were too doll before hand. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Adam S

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have high expectations for the price, but this product really was a let down. The guides to keep your knife at the correct angle collapse with any pressure so they don't hold the blades where they should when pulling. The motor has such low power that it slows to a halt with even slight pressure, and the blade "skips" on top of the grinding wheels. Just skip this one and pay for a better sharpener. You'll regret buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: It's OK, but nothing to get too excited about
customer_reviews.text: I found it does alot better on small, lightweight kitchen knives, but it's not very good on heavier, bigger KaBar's. It tends to bog down pretty easy, even without any down pressure, and it gives a bit of a wavy edge, like another reviewer took pictures of. Like other reviewers said, the guides will move in and out freely, no matter where they're set. Overall, it works best on light knives, and you better not care about the finish it leaves, because it's not smooth, but the knives are sharp. I guess for 45 bucks, it would be great for those who can't hand sharpen very well.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Old knives turned to new
customer_reviews.text: I've had some knives for 10 years and have been sharpening them as I go, but this unit revived them from the grave. Perfect result and my knives have been sharp for the past 6 weeks after the first sharpening. Get this item and sharpen every item in your house.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Great option
customer_reviews.text: Hey, I saw a add to send your knifes in to get them sharpened. For 10 bucks a knife. Well this gem will pay for itself. I remember growing up my parents had a electric knife sharpener and I always wanted one so I bought this guy. Because he dose many different types of knifes. It's a good item to keep in the cabinet you can pull it out to sharpen a knife in a few minutes. I hate dull knife. It works really good.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Dean

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty good deal at this price point
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a much better sharpener, so this one is a little disappointing due to that. But when it comes down to it, there's actually not really much to be disappointed about at all. At the price range that this sharpener sells within, it's actually a very decent deal, and way better than a lot of the other stuff in the same price range.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ax

customer_reviews.title: Our knives have never been sharper!
customer_reviews.text: I have been sharpening kitchen knives about ever two months with a manual tool. This sharpener cuts the time by about 95%. Seriously! I should add that the cutting wheels are new, so they leave some micro teeth on the blades. Although it may even contribute to better cutting, I expect this effect to reduce as the fine wheel ages, making the blade even sharper.
customer_reviews.author: Edward F. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Bounces your knife and ruins it!
customer_reviews.text: The knife bounces a bit and acquires staircase-like pattern on the edge, as shown in others' photos. I couldn't stabilize it even when I tried varying the amount of pressure and pull speed. Presumably the bounce is due to imperfections in the wheel (not a flat circle). My dream of quick sharpening is shattered and I'm going back to my water stones.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Well the instructions are straight to the point and easy to figure out and use. Just sharpened 3 different sizes and styles of knives and it worked like a charm. It took less than 30 secs for each blade to sharpen, its feels brand new again from how sharp they are. It says you can try it on seraded knives but I’m not going to attempt.
customer_reviews.author: Kierra

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are not clear, works well
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are unclear as to how to hold the blade when running it thru the sharpener. IT says both "hold parallel" and lay it against the side discs. IT can't be both. I tried it to begin with by laying it against the side discs, it seems ok. UPDATE: Found a video that makes usage clear, and yes used properly it works very very well. One star minus for poor instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Ceridwen

customer_reviews.title: The equipment arrived well and without problems, but the ...
customer_reviews.text: The equipment arrived well and without problems, but the box was all broken and mistreated, if it was not for the protection inside the box, the equipment would arrive broken.
customer_reviews.author: Erne

customer_reviews.title: Versatile & Dependable
customer_reviews.text: My daughter takes her knives to San Francisco to a professional. Fights the traffic to get there, and sometimes has to make two trips and its expensive. You can do a great job on any knife from a big hunting knife to a small pairing knife with this sharpener. I have no experience with another brand of sharpener. Don't need it. This thing is rugged, reliable and well made. If you read and follow the directions (its easy) you will never have another dull knife in your kitchen again. Next visit to daughters house, I am taking this with me. The results should convince her to stop all the craziness of driving to the knife guy.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan L. Mayhew

customer_reviews.title: 12 months of keeping our knives sharp
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this sharpener for about a year now, and have found it very good at sharpening knives. One thing to look out for is you can end up with a bit of a shoulder at the base of the blade if you are not careful to align the knife when first starting so always start with a junk knife to do a quick refresher before moving on to your high quality knives. We cook a lot, and use all of our knives frequently and have found the edge this puts on the blades to be very durable. Would recommend as a good sharpener, just take your time, follow the directions and don't put pressure on the blades.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has worked as a cook I’d recommend this one. It’s so easy to use that I taught my 12 year old sister how to use it. My mom’s knives were dull and this solved the problem. They’re as sharp as a knife you’d find at a restaurant kitchen. The knives sharpen quick and easy. I was skeptical but this is a good investment. No need to spend extra money on the more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Olivares

customer_reviews.title: Pretty helpful sharpener.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas so I had him review this: Be advised that this sharpener takes up some kitchen real estate, but if you are like me and demand your knives be maintained, you will love it. You just have to get accustomed to how to use it, but the instructions are clear and a little practice should suffice. It’s not going to sharpen scissors by the way, and you aren’t going to want to use this on garden tools either (which they make clear). It’s for kitchen only, and frankly it’s designed for those who actually do cook for enjoyment, and don’t like using a sharpening iron (or are not confident using one).
customer_reviews.author: Holly Gordon

customer_reviews.title: You can't do better for the short amount of time it takes.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this sharpener. I did all 25 knives in the cutting block and 2 pocket knives in somewhere around a half-hour / 40 minutes. Could someone with lots of patience get a better edge with a stone? Of course. However, I'd bet they couldn't in this short amount of time! The adjustable guides make it hard to mess up. After using the knife & before putting it away, I now give it 2 passes through the 3rd stage (hone) wheel, so they all stay sharp. That takes less than 30 seconds.. can't beat that!
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: A really great sharpener...
customer_reviews.text: It does everything it says it does and then some. Had a bunch of knifes that were dull as a rock sitting in the shop and just collecting dust. Started with the resurfacing wheel and then went to the other two and now they cut paper like its butter. I highly recommend this sharpener if you have dull knifes you want to bring back to working order. Going to buy a couple more and give them away as Christmas presents to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Big Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best Sharpener for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have tried different sharpeners and wet stones and nothing works as good as this one. I was about to replace most of my knifes because they were not as sharp as I like them. After using this sharpener they work like new. I pass the knifes about 5 times on the polishing stone once per week or after heavy use. Knifes are extremely sharp after using this sharpener, be careful. I have taken the tip of my finger nails a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Dante

customer_reviews.title: Poor sharpening of knives
customer_reviews.text: This sharpener leave a grove along the edge of the blade which makes the knife a dull edge. Poor quality stones leave a poor edge on your blades
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.text: Just received today. Based on the video, i expected this thing to sharpen a hunting knife, pocket knife, etc.. Used to try to sharpen my stainless hunting knife (straight blade/edge) and the first time i put the knife in, it almost stopped the wheels.. The unit appears to not have anywhere near enough "torque / motor speed" to do what's necessary.. Then tried my small pocket knife.. same issues.. didn't seem to do me any good to even try. I wish i'd shopped more. I would not recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm 64 and realize that my wife is gonna have dull knives when I'm gone
customer_reviews.text: I've been sharpening knives since I was a kid using stones for say 55 years now... I'm 64 and realize that my wife is gonna have dull knives when I'm gone. So, rather than try and teach her how to use a stone I opted for this. It, of course, takes a lot more steel off quickly than a stone so your knives will be whittled away a little quicker, but, with a light, gentle stroke, paying attention to keep gentle pressure on the guides, anyone can put a razors edge on their knives. I like it and she will too....no, of course I haven't told her why I got it, you think I want to make her cry?
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Howe

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: This item has a weak motor, does not do the job properly, it needs a larger, stronger motor, not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Love

customer_reviews.title: I won't be looking for a knife sharpener anymore. This is great.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome sharpener. I bought a set of expensive knives but they get dull so quickly with any of the other sharpeners I've used. With this the knives stay sharp for weeks. This thing is so easy to use. I feel like anyone would get great results. Very happy. I won't need to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Works like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: Read the instructions and started sharpening kitchen knives, did a fantastic job. Decided to see how it would work on a pocket knife and that was a fantastic job also. I especially like the three settings for different knife thickness'.
customer_reviews.author: LFoster516

customer_reviews.title: Great knife sharpner, for once other reviews aren't bogus.
customer_reviews.text: So it was between buying a new set of knives between $100-150 after having ours for almost 4 years or buying this for $35 and giving our current knives a lease on life. I went with the $35 option and I am very happy I did, the instructions aren't clear and that is why I am deducting a star, but all else this product delivers! I spent 2, 3 minutes on each knife and I can't be happier. Last but not least, this is not a small sharpener, it is quite big.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: It even worked on my thick cleaver. One thing: CAREFUL. I sharpened my favorite Henkels 5" chef's knife, and even though I was gentle and just "laid" the knife on the grinder, it took part of the blade next to the handle clean off.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: 4.5 stars... But err on the up side because wow. We have Zwilling knives from Germany I personally bought and have been extra careful with. Let's just simple say, we sharpened a few first to test, and ultimately felt very comfortable putting my Zwilling through it. Good sharpener. Did every non serrated knife in the house and even my pocket knives. Only on a really nice buck did this need a few passes on the course side.
customer_reviews.author: Expat

customer_reviews.title: Best Sharpener for the money by far.
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews and looked at a lot of sharpeners. This one has the roughing feature that even some of the expensive ones don't. I used a friend's sharpener that was a very expensive one and spent almost an hour on one knife before ordering this one. My knifes were extremely dull as they have not had a sharpening in almost thirty years. I did a whole set of these knives in less than an your with this unit. It is by far the best sharpener I have used. And the price was right at $29.99 as well. There are sharpeners out there for $150 that did not work like this one. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Produced a micro serrated/jagged blade
customer_reviews.text: Not satisfied. It made micro serrations on the blade. They were rough and jagged feeling. It did make the knife sharp, but the roughness was offputting. Returned it and bought the chefs choice 15xv. Within two minutes of sharpening blade with chefs choice, I could shave arm hair. Chefs choice cost more and works much better producing nice smooth blade and extremely sharp blade.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Willoughby

customer_reviews.title: if you want a very good knife sharpener that doesn't cost an arm and a ...
customer_reviews.text: if you want a very good knife sharpener that doesn't cost an arm and a leg this is the one to get I have a chefs choice pro and this does just as good a job is that plus it has adjustable sizing so they keep mice and knives and my sick knives good I've used them on my hinckley and it does a very good job and doesn't eat a lot of meadow I've even use it on the Old Hickory knife that had been in the drawer for years and it pulled the edge right back up
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: I collect knives.
customer_reviews.text: I collect knives of all sizes. I decided to give this a try mainly because I really love titanium coated (rainbow coat) so I needed something that would not damage the coat on the knife, and I was impressed with how easy it was to use on any knife. I really like the edge it put on my favorite knives. I strongly recommend this to any person who needs to keep their knives sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Its ok.
customer_reviews.text: The motor is not very strong. It stops several times when sharpening a knife with little to no pressure. I would have thought for $60 bucks it would have been a little more robust.
customer_reviews.author: B. Terry

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well.
customer_reviews.text: Dosent sharpen well. Get a ceramic rod instead. It's adequate to get a "close enough " sharpness but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: wm drew

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, but it's Huge!
customer_reviews.text: This is is a mammoth sized machine. It's pretty fancy and will do a really nice job at honing mega dull knives (you may have to do various passes for each knife, depending on their dullness), but it's actually quite voluminous and if you have a small kitchen, this will definitely be a challenge to put away. Giving it 4 out of 5 stars because unless you have a super big kitchen, you can't really keep this out, and I would love to do that, but I can't.
customer_reviews.author: Alfiegirl63

customer_reviews.title: This is a great knife sharpener
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife sharpener. I was using a 3 sided stone prior to this and the edge was difficult to keep at the right angle while sharpening. I have 6 chefs knives, 1 boning knife, and a pairing knife. This sharpened them all. I was also able to repair a knife with a broken tip as well as a couple knives that had developed waves in the blades from other sharpeners.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable Guides are Flimsy and Innacurate
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable guides were not evenly spaced. The left one had more space than the right one on both stage 2 and 3. Also, the adjustable guides move way too easily. With the lightest of pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Saved my knives and my wallet
customer_reviews.text: Really gets knives razor sharp. Coarse grinding wheels on left side will only be used for severely damaged knives. Will cut a lot of material and remove nicks and dents. A few passes with the fine white wheels will keep an edge razor sharp. Use weekly on our cheap foodservice knives and they stay very sharp and safe.
customer_reviews.author: D. Yamauchi

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth every penny—BUY ONE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been thanking myself every time use this product—it works fantastic! No more straining to sharpen knives. This little darling does it all for you with the touch of a button. Wish I had bought this years ago. For another great product see
customer_reviews.author: Frank McClain

customer_reviews.title: Great sharpener
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased the sharpener a few days ago. I had several knives that were in dire need of a good sharpening. It has served its purpose. I have used all 3 cutting /honing edges on some of the knives to get a razor sharp edge. What a difference a sharp knife makes. Its easy to use once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bibby

customer_reviews.title: This is a very reasonably priced and very good knife sharpener!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are great, it is easy to use, and my knives came out really sharp. I sharpened several different types an sizes of knives, and by simply following the instructions, the results were fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: ned j. augustyniak

customer_reviews.title: Great sharpener, but be careful
customer_reviews.text: Great sharpener, but be careful. The coarse sharpener on the left can gouge your knife if you're not careful. I wouldn't run a $300 knife through anything, but the far right (fine) sharpener. Actually I would take a $300 knife to a professional to sharpen. I did sharpen 20 older low quality very dull kitchen knives in 15 minutes. They all cut extremely well after that, and my friends were all impressed. I only needed to used the far left (coarse) sharpener on one of the knives.
customer_reviews.author: J. Braun

customer_reviews.title: Great sharpener for the price
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best sharpener I've purchased for less than $50 bucks and works great! I'm very satisfied with this sharpener and would recommend it. the only issue I have is you have to run your knife through the first setting No1 lightly to get knife ready for final sharpening, seems a little weak but after that, the No 2 and 3 setting works great. Better then Chefs Choice sharpeners that you would pay over a $100 for!
customer_reviews.author: Kel Herman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this knife sharpener now for about 3 years. As far as I'm concerned it sharpens all of my knives very well. Keep in mind ypur not getting them professionally sharpened, but this does a fine job. I use this 3 or 4 times a year on most all of my knives and I am very pleased. You don't really need 2 apply pressure and just keep an eye on that edge.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: The product functions fine, but it doesn't produce the results I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with it. Works, kinda. Used it on a few knives the day I got it, even spent time practicing on a sacrificial knife, but haven't used it since. It's settings are kind of crude. And doesn't allow you to get the full blade against the sharpening stones with some knives.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Wood

customer_reviews.title: Impressive and beats the competition
customer_reviews.text: Got the Chef's Choice 250 (same price as this Presto 8810) from Amazon and was not impressed with blade sharpness. Then purchased the Presto Eversharp 8810 (same price) and compared results. Presto knives came out very sharp (passed fingernail test whereas the Chef's Choice just slid without grabbing) - blew away the Chef's Choice by a mile.
customer_reviews.author: Dietmar Schott

customer_reviews.title: We feel it would have been a great product, but upon opening it and testing it ...
customer_reviews.text: We feel it would have been a great product, but upon opening it and testing it out with our chef knife, we quickly realized that the motors in Stage 2 and Stage 3 weren't working properly. We requested a return the day we received it, and the return label arrived today in the mail since we have no printer to print it out. It wasn't an item we absolutely needed, we just wanted to buy it to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle F.

customer_reviews.title: Good for dull knives
customer_reviews.text: This works okay. I would use this on lower quality knives or knives that are extremely dull. It takes off a bit of the metal from the knife. I returned and got a wet stone.
customer_reviews.author: Josh N

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Knife Sharpener
customer_reviews.text: Excellent knife sharpener. I have been using stone for years and tried other electric knife sharpener brands. This is the sharpest I have ever gotten my knives. It was highly recommended to me by a friend. Glad I tried it out. I followed the directions on which slots to insert the knife and was amazed at the results.
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job really well
customer_reviews.text: The attached suction cups keeps it steady, so using it is a breeze. And my knives are now sharp. Also has various settings for size and kind of knife, scissors, chopper, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Keb

customer_reviews.title: Great knife sharpener.
customer_reviews.text: Best knife sharpener I’ve ever had so glad I found one like my sisters.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Finally - a sharpener that produces a fantastic edge
customer_reviews.text: Finally - a sharpener that surpasses my old fire-stone machine. This sharpener won't let you use too much pressure. the motor practically stops if you try. That means you get super sharp edges. I'm talking "slice paper" sharp. I put edges on 20 knives in about 20 minutes. Two weeks later, they're still great. Just remember to set the blade selector for the proper blade thickness. And...follow the instructions! You may not need stage one - that's for a knife so dull it won't cut butter. 3 or 4 passes through each level is all you need to go from dull to just about surgical.
customer_reviews.author: Skyspy

customer_reviews.title: a good unit for the money
customer_reviews.text: I pondered between this and a unit costing 3 times the price, and other than this one being slightly under powered... I think it is actually a better unit than the more expensive one. easy to use, simple adjustments, and does the job just fine. get a diamond hone stick for final sharpen and you are good to go... and still way under $100 cost
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD SCHERR

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sharpener - Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This sharpener is much more powerful than my under-powered Chef's Choice sharpener that would constantly stall. It has adjustments for the thickness of different blades and puts a nice edge on all my knives. It is substantial and stays put on the counter with rubber suction cups. . The only negative is that it does not sharpen far enough back on the blade (toward the handle). The plastic guides prevents the back portion of some knife blades from contacting the grinding wheels. On some knives this leaves up to a half inch of unsharpened blade. If your knives are blade from front to back, then they should work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Toolman-PA

customer_reviews.title: No bueno
customer_reviews.text: I returned this because it made every blade that I attempted to sharpen fuller than it was before I started sharpening it. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: lponcefb

customer_reviews.title: Must not be sold outside the US
customer_reviews.text: I received this product yesterday 07.03.2020. The product looked good before I decided to try it. After less than 5 seconds of use, smoke started to come out of the machine. I turned off the machine and checked the data plate under the machine. I read 120V 60Hz. Why is Amazon selling this outside the US? No other country uses this voltage and frequency. Not in Europe and not in Asia. In Norway, where I come from, we use 60Hz on ships, but not on land. This product had a record short life.
customer_reviews.author: Henning Hope

customer_reviews.title: Does an excellent job!
customer_reviews.text: I have for many years tried to maintain the sharpness of our kitchen knives with an assortment of sharpening implements. The Presto knife sharpener did an excellent job. As all of them were very dull it did take some time to get them sharp and it does take some patience to just let the weight of the knife do the job. That being said I'm sure that a light touchup on the finishing wheel will keep them ready to go. The price on this sharpener is a great one.
customer_reviews.author: Emmett

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have sharp Knives!!!
customer_reviews.text: I hesitates awhile to get an electric knife sharpener, mostly due to price. But I am glad I finally got one. This is so easy to use, my son tried it and it sharpens very well and quickly. I can now sharpen all my knives quickly and without wearing out my arm.
customer_reviews.author: real_buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it u ca literally sharen anything knives pocket knives scissors we love this it’ll get em so dgaf they’ll cut thru bones great product
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: User friendly and easy to use! Must read instructions or you will damage your knives.
customer_reviews.text: This product is the best consumer grade knife sharpener I've ever bought. This will require a learning curve so use a cheap knife first. The guides are easy to use but if not careful you can damage your blades due to how fast it can grind down metal. Overall quality is great and very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Yair

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to get a knife sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but hard to get a knife sharp. Sold it at garage sale and bought a Work Sharp belt knife sharpener. It works very well.
customer_reviews.author: sandy barnhart

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Works good. The motor didn't turn well at first (had very little power), but then something happened and it had all they power I needed. No clue what happened. Good selection of stones, sharpens the blades very fast. My only complaint is that the plastics guards prevent me from getting super close which is an issue for my smallest pocket knives. It leaves about a 1/4" of my small blades untouched, but it does fine with the everyday kitchen knives. It's a turning wheel with sharpening stones. What more do you want?
customer_reviews.author: J. McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Good to a point .... get it?
customer_reviews.text: Works, ok.... if you apply slight downward pressure the motor stops. The ''guides'' will flex causing you to put waves in your blade.... but if you use a dainty light handed smooth pull then you can get somewhat of a decent edge on a blade.... I'm not trying to say the machine sucks, but rather its not the best out there...
customer_reviews.author: brian wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great sharpening but flimsy angle adjuster
customer_reviews.text: First off, it does sharpen the knifes great, as stated by many other reviewers. I had to return mine due to the flimsy construction in regards to the thin/medium/thick settings. One of the settings did not change when adjusting from medium to middle. Also, the orange adjusters are easily pushed in once the knife is inserted and therefore changes the angle. I wanted to like it, but for the price that is paid for it's just too flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: CUT things like a ninja master..or sushi chef.
customer_reviews.text: Local sushi/hibachi chef recommended this to me. If you have ever been to a good Japanese restaurant you know they keep their blades SHARP. Bought it and put it in the pantry and forgot about it. Got it out on a rainy Saturday and now every blade in the house has a razor edge. Follow the directions and its easy as pie.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Every knife in my house is like a razor
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this sharpener. Every knife in my collection is now razor sharp thanks to this sharpener. You have to be sure to hold the blade firm but not too firm when making a pass so it doesn't bounce around and make a funny looking cut. After I got the hang of it it was easy to do. Only start with stage one if the blade is very dull then only make 2 passes on each side. The machine runs very quiet as well and the suction on the underside helps keep it steady on the table.
customer_reviews.author: Jaden

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used other sharpeners like this before, but never had one of this caliber. For the price, it is perfect for home use. I have a nice set of kitchen knives (not super high end, but nice), and in about half an hour, sharpened all 15 of them. They are now razor sharp. I always test with a tomato, and with little pressure was able to slice through with a clean cut. I would definitely recommend this sharpener. Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Manning

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks.
customer_reviews.text: Instantly sharpens knives and after using the sharpener, tomatoes and other vegetables slice so easily. Good purchase and I am well satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty sharpener
customer_reviews.text: Plug in, set the thickness of your blade and ready to sharp! Very easy to use and sharpen my knives pretty well. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: James K.

customer_reviews.title: Just like brand new!
customer_reviews.text: My knife hasn’t been this sharp for a long time. My Steak knives to, it sharpened a little better after I oiled the knife first!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie S

customer_reviews.title: Presto Professional Electric Knife Sharpener
customer_reviews.text: Love this sharpener. It has three different stones that go from coarse to fine and is adjustable for the thickness of the blades. It will not do Scissors or Serated Blades. Good Product and a Good Price.
customer_reviews.author: Hammercl

customer_reviews.title: Gives a nice sharp edge
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable plastic blade guides are kinda flimsy. They deflect if you put any pressure on them. But if you use them as a mainly visual guide to holding the knife blade at the proper angle, the sharpener works great. Ran all of our kitchen knives through all three grits at first to get the proper bevel, and now I just run them once over the fine grit disk every couple weeks to spruce up the edges, or sometimes the medium grit and then the fine one if the blade has been abused.
customer_reviews.author: William Bain

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: so far a great product. all the knives in the kitchen are sharpened now. no skill needed to use this sharpner. my wife loves it.
customer_reviews.author: franno

customer_reviews.title: I recommend gently gliding the knife through
customer_reviews.text: This product is works well. It is all in the handling of the knife when gliding through the sharpener. If it is a large knife that you are sharpening it can stop the rotation of the sharpener. I recommend gently gliding the knife through, apply zero pressure, do not press down, it is not necessary. If it is a larger - heavier knife support its weight, if you do not do this, the sharpener will jam due to the weight of the knife.
customer_reviews.author: MiaAthena

customer_reviews.title: Very good knife sharpener
customer_reviews.text: After looking at reviews of various home knife sharpeners, selected Presto 08810 based on favorable ratings.This machine is easy to learn to use, and sharpens as advertised. One caution: be careful when using the first, heavy duty slot to the far left. It is meant for quite dull blades and you need to know that if not used with a long slow pull through the slots, it can nick a blade. The finer sharpening options on the right, with the adjustments for three different widths of blades gives a very good edge to many sizes of knives. It is a quick sharpener and angles the blades correctly. Beats using sharpening stones which we have used for years.
customer_reviews.author: lm

customer_reviews.title: but I have a hard time believing a scalpel could have cut more cleanly or easily. I'm pretty sure I'm not an idiot
customer_reviews.text: Cut my finger on my fifteen year old chef's knife last night while doing the dishes. I sharpened that knife using this sharpener last week. I'm no surgeon, but I have a hard time believing a scalpel could have cut more cleanly or easily. I'm pretty sure I'm not an idiot, but I'm also pretty sure this thing is relatively idiot proof. And I've only run... maybe a dozen knives through it. From that standpoint, I suppose it's paid for itself already. If this thing is somehow still working and working as well in my twilight years... I believe I'd let it marry my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: John Chimpo

customer_reviews.title: Never buy this, it is terrible!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk way under powered and knife angle guides won't stay put in one place they keep moving so you can't get an accurate angle ever!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: A must have in the kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Mom, mother told me to look a good sharpening stone, when she showed me all her kitchen knives, heck no your not getting a sharpening stones, then i bought this, this machine does the Job my mothers Kitchen knives is dull as a rounded spoon LOL. Just an FYI some steel and super dull knives may takes 5-10 passes on the second stages after that you are good to go! Very recommended
customer_reviews.author: Christoper

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had many kitchen knives that needed sharpening and this unit did the job. It is a three stage sharpener but I found I never required the first stage on my knives. It takes a little practice to hold a knife at the correct angle but once you do you'll have nicely sharp knives. My only complaint is the motor is somewhat weak so you cannot use much pressure when sliding a knife against the grinding stones. I sharpened all my carving, steak and serrated knifes just fine. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: BWK Badger

customer_reviews.title: This works.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works. This thing took knives destined for the scrapyard and brought them back fo cutting. The knives had deep deep dings and chip. I had to take more passes, but it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: This is bigger than it looks online, good product
customer_reviews.text: This sharpener worked great for sharpening dull knives. The setting for the thickness of the blades is handy but the three different grinding stones makes for sharper edges. The course with the knives are really dull, then to medium to fine. If the blades are not really dull, just use the medium or the fine grinding stones. Be careful as you knives will be really sharp. If you are reaching into a sink with sudsy soap, it is easy to cut yourself by reaching under the suds. I don't think you'll be disappointed with the piece of kitchen equipment. Be sharp!
customer_reviews.author: The Polarbare

customer_reviews.title: Try it, you will love it :-)
customer_reviews.text: I bought a "used" sharpener and was pleasantly surprised. I sharpened every knife I had and looked for more. I used the chefs choice at work and found a review of sharpeners that convinced me to try this unit. The ability to change angles attracted me to this unit plus the positive reviews. It handled fillet knives to hunting knives with no problems. I wish I had bought one years ago! Be careful with the first stone, it is very aggressive. Try #2 first and follow with #3. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Helo Driver

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 09/2016
customer_reviews.text: Been using this device for over 3 years now ... still sharpens all my knives like a pro .. has not let me down. By far the best knife sharpener I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly unsurprised
customer_reviews.text: Having looked at on-line reviews of the Presto 08810 and other brands and models, I felt confident in ordering this model. I sharpened all of our kitchen knives, which I had been previously trying to sharpen with a manual sharpener, and was very pleased with the result. I now just make several swipes on a honing steel before each use and have knives that make easy work of cutting everything from bread to roasts. I have only one suggestion. A video demonstrating use of the sharpener would have been useful. It's not rocket science, but I would have liked to see how to use the sharpener properly beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: My husband was skeptical about this sharpener I bought him for Christmas. He likes to do his sharpening by hand. I bought it because of it's versatility in types of knives you can sharpen, with different angles and thicknesses. It works like a charm! My kitchen knives have never been sharper! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: HappyChickenLady

customer_reviews.title: Puts a good edge on different thicknesses of knives.  Fast and versatile
customer_reviews.text: I can sharpen knives much faster than on a stone. This one is quiet and effective. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Forrest Dinwiddie

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Ok for what is worth. Don’t spect to have a sharp knife in the first run because this tool is not magical. Keep in mind you are trying to sharpen steel. Be patient and run it ti’ll it gets to where you want it to be. It will get there eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sharpener especially for the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: My buddy has one similar. He paid around 120 bucks versus this one that I paid about 43 bucks for. My sharpener is equally as good for much less money!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Barbour

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have gotten 10 years ago
customer_reviews.text: This sharpener is fantastic. For years I have been using a stone doing it the old fashioned way. I would spend several evenings sharpening while watching tv in order to get through all of my knifes. Now it is a breeze, and I can easily just get this from the cabinet and sharpen one or two knifes with no hassle. I takes about 3 minutes to take a knife from very dull to very sharp. Although since buying this I no longer have knifes that are very dull, never.
customer_reviews.author: Big Pappa

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife sharpener. Easy to use just follow the directions and be careful your knives will be razor sharp. Now just need to find a place in the kitchen to keep it when not in use, it is a little on the large size. It has suction cup type feet on the bottom of it to keep it in place and not move around when you are using it which is a nice feature. Petty much any type & width knife can be sharpened with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Not PRO quality
customer_reviews.text: But certainly all I need for the kitchen. I have a nice set of knives that I like to keep pretty sharp so it doesn't hurt as much when I slice myself. This sharpener does all that I need. You will hear lots of griping about how the angle holders don't hold steady or that this device doesn't give a perfect home. There is some truth to that. But for the money you will get a nice edge and with a little practice the angle will turn out just fine. Or you could spend a huge amount of money on a different machine. Bang for the buck, this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: RopeMan

customer_reviews.title: Good for tool knives, bad for fine kitchen knives.
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my rougher tool knives, but it is coarse and I would be very concerned about damaging nice kitchen knives with it. I recommend this for tool knives, machetes, etc. but I don't recommend it at all for good kitchen knives.
customer_reviews.author: Dirt

customer_reviews.title: in fact it destroyed one of my favorite knives. I wouldn’t even recommend this to someone ...
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t sharpen at all, in fact it destroyed one of my favorite knives. I wouldn’t even recommend this to someone I hate. I returned it in the end.
customer_reviews.author: bryan

product_meta.title: Presto Professional Electric Knife Sharpener
product_meta.description: Design:Knife SharpenerProfessional EverSharp Electric Knife Sharpener works great on kitchen knives, hunting knives and fillet knives. 120 volts, 60 Hz only
feature_bullets: Easy 3-stage sharpening system for professional results at home, anytime.
Sharpens kitchen and sport knives, even Santoku knives.
Blade thickness selector adjusts guides to optimum sharpening angle.
Select thick for hunting knives, medium for chef's knives and standard kitchen knives, and thin for light blades like fillet and paring knives.
Blade guides hold knife at the perfect angle for no-guess sharpening.
Extra-fine-grit ceramic wheel fine hones the blade to a razor-sharp edge.
Three Stage Sharpening system for professional results at home.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,006 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
